Reviews.Title: “"Great for fun, NOT for business"”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: From the time one enters the Arrival Lobby on the 9th floor, through the Reception Lobby at the 103rd floor to the guest rooms above and even to the Ozone club on the 118th floor, hotel staff hurry ahead with polite greetings, offering to carry bags, pressing elevator buttons and generally making guests and visitors feel pampered. Checking in took about five minutes for my five-night stay. Views from the guestrooms are spectacular whichever direction one looks; on a clear day, one can literally see forever. At night, the Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines are impressively beautiful. However, the expansive glass walls designed to capture natural light and facilitate breath-taking views may preclude acrophobics from staying. My guest room is very comfortably appointed with a king-sized bed flanked by twin night tables, a good-sized writing desk with an executive chair on one side and a guest chair on the other, LG 42" flat panel TV and DVD player, Nespresso machine, minibar fridge, wingchair and ottoman, low credenza with large drawers and full-sized wardrobes with integrated smaller-than-ideal electronic safe. Comfortable bedroom slippers are free, as are the Nespresso capsules, various tea bags, abundant bottled water and fresh fruit (which were never replenished after the first day). Free internet access is available both via WiFi and a cable with RJ45 male jack. The well-designed bathroom features Kohler sanitaryware and Asprey bath products. There is a full-sized bathtub with a small TV recesssed into the wall, adjoining glass cubicles for shower and toilet (the latter with frosted glass), twin undercounter washbasins with drawers beneath (one of which contains the hairdryer and a vanity box with dentalkit, sewing kit, comb, nail file, etc). The generous use of mirrors makes the well-lit bathroom appear larger. Electrically operated day and night curtains work very well, as do the thoughtfully-positioned lights and switches located discreetly in panels that swivel out from the sides of both night tables.. So what's not to like? WiFi speeds are slow-to-barely-tolerable and the mobile signal for SingTel's Bridge Dataroam Unlimited partner, CSL, varies from atrocious to non-existent. The Michelin-starred Tin Lung Heen served surprisingly bland dishes - but the service staff are good. However, service staff at the buffet breakfast are friendly but not very competent (for example, after waiting 45 minutes for his scrambled eggs, my colleague was finally offered two eggs sunny side up) and Ozone is understaffed, especially when it gets busy past 2200hrs. The hotel's location is great if one wants only to spend time in the Elements mall or International Commerce Centre but is out of the way for activities that require a trek to Tsim Sha Tsui or Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: svaroq
Reviews.Content: Was there for a few days break. Based on some reviews, I was bit afraid to pay the price and be disappointed. Disappointed I was not! I was really impressed and amazed. And I am picky (I work in the industry). Was upgraded to a Deluxe Harbour Suite I think. Everything in the room was perfect. And the views! A dream. So much so that I spent much more time in the room than I usually do. Love the Nespresso machines and the fact that they notice which capsules yu like best and replenish accordingly on a daily basis adding more of your favorites. Swimming pool and jacuzzis on top floor amazing. I was so nicely surprised about the outdoor jacuzzi. Imagine an outdoor jacuzzi on the 118th floor of a building! Service was great. Not pretentious but very down to earth classy. Always here to notice and help without being overwhelming. Breakfast by the windows was just unreal. Slightly disappointed by food quality and limited choice though. All in all, unforgettable experience. If you are looking for a very special treat, go for it! And don't hesitate to pay more for Harbour views. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Low customer care! No internet during my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Forgaciu M
Reviews.Content: They are full of clients that is why they do not care very much on every client as they considered people will come anyway! No internet during my stay with them- 2 nights, which is unbelievebale and their answers to this issue...so stupid! Wrong attitude on the reception desk- people staying in line for check out! A lot of employees for no purpose...just big job titles..no real job for them! They really need training on understanding that their salaries are paid by the clients! Management team should be changed- top level! Location, location. location! But...do not forget to really care on your clients! They feel your attitude! Weak up!

Reviews.Title: “High tea at the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: NFitzdelfini
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton was one of our choices for Hong Kong however we decided on the Four Seasons so we went to visit anyway to check it out for next time. We had High Tea in the Club Lounge. The building is amazing, a real sense of luxury pervades and the views are phenomenal. We were disappointed with the service, we waited some time for food and we found ourselves having to really try to get the attention of staff which was a surprise for a high-end establishment. More staff in the lift areas on the ground and in the lobby would be a good thing for people visiting for the first time. Highly recommend a visit but it's not the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ckv500
Reviews.Content: Although short cab ride to the Star Ferry on the Kowloon side (rather than within walking distance) the Ritz HK is more than worth the slight inconvenience. This is a spectacular hotel; the tallest hotel in the world. There are two lobbies - one at ground level, and one on the 100th floor. Our room was on 108 with grand views of Hong Kong harbour. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed. Service is excellent. The pool and night club on the top level is, without a doubt, worth a visit. You will not be disaapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: syd_traveller_8807
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Ritz given how high up the hotel is. Arrival was great with the commissionaire helping with our bags and advising to go up to level 103 to check in. The check in clerk was friendly and took us to our room to check in. Very nice. She noticed it was my mother's birthday when she checked her passport. 5 minutes after she left room service arrived with a cake from the hotel for her birthday!! The room is spacious enough with a nice bathroom. The bathroom amenities are nothing overly special though. The room comes with an iPod preloaded with songs which is a lovely touch. Ofcourse the views are superb, but don't expect too much - Hong Kong is renowned for its thick, blanketting smog. The hotel is above elements shopping centre which offers a lot of labels, a lot of restaurants, a supermarket and mannings and connects to the Kowloon MTR, convenient for the airport express. However it is quite difficult to get to Tsim Sha Tsui, needing a taxi or MTR to Hong Kong, walk to Central station and MTR back to TST. We had a club room, with access to the lounge. The food offerings are extensive but quite average given the brand. Breakfast was small, and although the pastries were all hand made they were burned. The service was good though and always with a smile. The Ozone bar is very impressive with indoor and outdoor areas and a huge selection of cocktails and gin, spent 2 of my 3 nights there. Nice music and again, impressive service. Steve was exceptional, finding us a table and remembering my drinks order on the second night. Overall the hotel is nice to stay at and provides very exceptional service, but does not deliver on the hype purveyed as far as room furnishings go.

Reviews.Title: “A smoothly run hotel that is lacking in some character”
Reviews.Author: Natalie W
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Ritz Carlton was very nice, the rooms were clean and generous sized, with lots of luxurious touches. We also very much enjoyed the Choclate libray where we had afternoon tea, and the Ozone bar where we went every evening. However, I would say that the hotel lacks a certain amount of character and charm, and is perhaps too formal for my tastes. It had a 'large hotel' feel abuot it, rather than the individual service that I like. It is very conviently linked to the airport, and you can check your bags in before you board the train, which makes for a very comfortable journey to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Ritz. Gorgeous design in every detail. The hotel is from 103rd and up. Guests enjoy panoramic view of Hong Kong from all corners. Great services and very thoughtful staffs. Stunning views + over the top design = sensual overload (in a good way). We didn't want to leave the hotel at all! Will definitely stay here again and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Daryllee84
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton HK is truly an amazing property. I've had the pleasure of staying there twice in the span of 6 months and in 2 different types of rooms. The location is very convenient, right above the Kowloon MTR station and the very high end ELEMENTS mall, although it does take a few escalators to get to the mall itself. Thanks to its location at Kowloon MTR, i was able to take the Airport Express straight from the airport to the hotel, pretty much. As the Ritz is from the 102nd floor of the ICC, it above all other hotels in the city. The views are spectacular and going up to your room feels like you're entering the clouds, which was very much the case on some days when the cloud cover was lower. Every room is well laid out and their famous attention to detail and service is evident here. High speed internet is easily accessible and each room has a blu-ray disc player, something I've yet to see in the other luxury properties I've stayed in, while the television had a wide range of news and entertainment options. The room is big by Hong Kong standards and it feels very well spaced out. The bed is extremely comfortable and the room controls at the side table, made it so much easier for a person to laze in bed. The bathroom is very spacious and the quality of the toiletries are excellent. The soaps/shampoos from Asprey, very plesant and soothing, the towels, so plush and comfortable. I actually tried to purchase them but were told that they weren't for sale, bummer. I absolutely enjoyed using their swimming pool, located on the 118th floor. The view is magnificent and the LED screens on the ceiling and walls, made it even more unique. The changing room provided a full range of amenities as well as a machine that helped spin your swimwear to a fairly dry state, again something I've never seen in other luxury hotels. The staff placed bottled water next to your towels at the pool and endeavour to remember your name. The pool temperature was just perfect and the music was very relaxing. In terms of F&B, I didn't really dine at their restaurants during both visits, though I did enjoy their breakfast buffet. The selection was outstanding and the harbour views even greater. I did try the tea at the Chocolate Library but it was a little too rich for my liking. The pastry shop at the entrance lobby had a nice selection of cakes and I had some delivered to my room, they were really good overall. The staff spoke good english and were able to assist me in my search for a small local bakery as well as recommendations for local pastries. They printed out maps and wrote out the locations in english as well as chinese for my to provide the taxi driver. Overall, I absolutely enjoyed my stay at the Ritz Carlton HK and I'm sure to look forward to the next time I might get to stay at this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: SHLaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed together with family which includes a 10 month old baby. We had arranged for baby amenities which was quite complete. Rooms are quite spacious, and overal very comfortable. The hotel is quite ostentatious in its decor, alot of money seems to have gone into the fitting out of this hotel. Location was great. Not too far from airport, and 15 min drive away from Central. The Elements mall just below the hotel was quite nice. Plenty of shops. Two bad points: the doors are not sound proof, and you can hear the ruckus in the corridor when some noisy tourists passed by. Also, because the lobby and rooms are so high up, the lifts took some time. But its a small issue. The pool was very nice. Baby loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself stay here”
Reviews.Author: Iser
Reviews.Content: This is something else. The arrival is an experience in itself. The hotel is on the 100th floor of the building. From your room every other sky scraper Hong Kong has to offer will look like a minature. I wont bore you with deatil, just get here and be Hong Kong savvy. The service, the room, the absolute feel of being engaged so high in the sky is a must have experience. Make sure you party at the Ozone, and vist the pool and gym. Both of which rank as the higest established of their kind in the world. Its expensive but its worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Heights”
Reviews.Author: BICBW
Reviews.Content: Visited the relatively new Ritz and thought it was easily the best new luxury hotel in Hong Kong and probably Asia. Arrival, entrance, lobby, reception area, all the way to the rooms was a great experience in design and luxury. The rooms were really nice though I was surprised about the single seater in the room - thankfully I was by myself. Guest room amenities and the whole touch of luxuries were really spot on. The hotel's restaurants were busteling with Hong Kong residents having a great lunch on the weekend. Most of my service encounters were really good, yet I thought that some of the reception girls were not genuine - just my observation. Awesome hotel though !

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: nicoline_hime
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hong Kong view from my room Friendly service Early check-in & Late check-out The swimming pool at level 118 is a must!!! Shopping heaven & restaurants galore (Elements shopping mall) and MTR station just downstairs.. Really worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a life time experience”
Reviews.Author: Rlouwerse
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in June, since it was on my list of wish hotels to visit once in your life and overall my stay was not disappointing. From the bellboys at the lobby till the reception desk staff, everybody was very friendly and helpful. I had no problems with check-in and my room was already available since I checked-in early. My Deluxe harbour room was very well equipped (42 inch flat screen, blu-ray DVD player, 160GB Ipod and Ipod docking station) with of course and impressive view on the Hong Kong harbour skyline. The bathroom had a separate bath and rain shower with enough amenities and towels for multiple persons. The room was also equipped with a Nespresso coffee maker with 3x2 coffee varieties to choose from. Furthermore the internet was working well, both wired and wireless access was available. In the late afternoon I first decided to take a swim and their swimming pool was very impressive, I never had been so impressed with a pool before. There was also a hot-tub and Jacuzzi to relax in. After my swim I went for dinner. I went for dinner at the lounge and bar restaurant and found my only bad experience of my stay. The staff of this outlet was in my experience very cold and un-personal. They seemed much too busy with themselves, rather than talking or paying attention to guests. When seated I asked if there was a seat available by the window, but unfortunately at that time there wasn’t any. A few minutes later, just besides me a window seat got available and asked the waiter if I could move. He did not seemed to be very happy with my question and seemed to be annoyed by my question. Since I did not care his personal attitude I moved to the seat anyway but again got a very cold and annoyed reaction. Once seated I ordered a burger and a small bottle of water, but got a large bottle of Evian instead. It was maybe a “pay-back” from this waiter to me, for asking too many questions. I found this very weird being a guest at a five star hotel. In total I had to pay HKD 325;- for this experience which was way too much. After dinner I went out for a drink, since I had a bad experience at this F&B outlet. Overall a great experience from all the services of the hotel except the F&B part. Since you have to pay so much for this once in a life time experience, you should also expact from a F&B outlet that the service should be 5 star too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & luxurious interior, great view and pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: canter0614
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband in April and stayed in Ritz HK in April. Our room faced harbor and the view was truly stunning. Eating in the restaurants above clouds is also interesting. We used swimming pool and gym and the experience was pleasant. The room was very luxurious and their attendtion to detail was amazing. Decoration in common areas like restaurants, reception was impressive. Staff were friendly, polite, prompt and classy. The only minor issue I can think of was - the lift area is too busy, the food is average. We had afternoon tea sets- the presentation was lovely - but the taste was disappointing. We had dinner - Cesar salad, lamb and steak,etc and the taste was so so, didn't match the price and image of top top hotel. Neither was breakfast. Overall, we enjoyed our stay with RC HK and I recommend people have the experience of architecture and beautiful/artistic interior.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Zerk
Reviews.Content: The RItz-Carlton Hong Kong is undoubtedly the best hotel in Hong Kong. The management and staff were exceptionally attentive to my needs and made sure that I always had everything that I needed. The staff at the Ritz-Carlton Hong Kong bend over backward to deliver on your every request. The restaurants are fantastic, although the buffet in Cafe 103 needs more variety. They are working with limited space and the food they offer is great, but a few more dishes would make all the difference. I highly recommend booking a room with Club Lounge access. The F&B selection in the lounge is fantastic and the added benefit of complimentary limousine service is well worth it. This hotel is officially one of my all-time favorites and I am excited at the prospect of my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Alexag05
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is known for many of its historic and established hotels (ie Peninsula), with VERY loyal customer bases. Ritz had their work cut out for them when they decided to enter this market but they delivered. This hotel serves as a refuge in the sky in a tremendously busy and hectic city. The decor in this hotel is incredible as is the service. I booked a package that included breakfast which was an excellent decision, the breakfast every morning was fantastic, and eating at the window in the mornings overlooking Victoria Harbor is truly an amazing experience. Perhaps the two best parts of the hotel are the bar on the roof (Ozone), which is the highest in the world, and the pool on the level below. Going for a morning swim overlooking Victoria Harbor was absolutely unreal. My only complaint however is that the pool was far too cold to really enjoy, so my friend and I ended up spending most of the time in the hot tub outside, which was also too cold actually. The pool should be kept much more warm so that its comfortable to relax in and enjoy the view. Other than that, you will remember your trip for the rest of your life if you stay at this hotel. With the high prices in Hong Kong, I seriously recommend spending an extra $200 a night to stay here. After visiting the other hotels in town, I knew I'd made the right decision.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Artsguy07
Reviews.Content: I've read many mixed reviews for this hotel, so we went wondering if we'd made the right choice. In retrospect, I'd say we couldn't have made a better choice. Yes, the hotel is quite expensive, but the expense is overshadowed by the sheer luxury and spectacle of it all. The rooms, while not huge, were sufficient and decorated with very high quality finishes. All features were very thoughtful. I especially liked the glowing alabaster countertop in the bathroom as the night light. Very slick indeed! Staying in the Ritz-Carlton Club was the best part. The food and service were absolutely sublime. The Club manager was the epitome of the kind of service expected in a first class hotel. The staff catered to our every need. As for the public areas, the hotel is all glitz. For some, this may be off-putting. I liked the glitz as a nice change from the usual feel of a more traditional Ritz-Carlton. All areas were immaculately clean and brimming in excess. Again, the finishes were opulent and well done. After a very late night arrival into Hong Kong and being quite jet lagged, we partied the night and morning away in the oh-so-swanky Ozone nightclub at the top of the building. It was quite exhilarating to have a cocktail outside at 116 floors. The spa, fitness area and pool were mesmerizing in their level of detail. It was obvious that the designer intended to wow the guests. Again, this hotel is EXPENSIVE and I would have loved to be able to stay there and spend less. But, it was The Ritz-Carlton and it is Hong Kong after all. So, in my case, I got exactly what I expected; a world class stay, in a world class hotel in a world class city at world class prices. It was worth every HK dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Penciltoon
Reviews.Content: The pluses: The great lounge singer named Glenda. She not only sings well but she is beautiful, classy,elegant and so nice to watch. Her elegance and class fits nicely into the old world with a modern twist setting. She sings in the lounge on the 103rd floor. The amazing gym and pool area. I loved the outdoor warm jacuzzi, the indoor jacuzzi and the cold plunge pool that knocks you off your senses. You have got to try the indoor cold plunge pool! I felt so relaxed and energized after. Don't second guess yourself, just take the plunge, dip your head and run out! The indoor pool was very welcoming with just the right temperature. I did notice that there were not enough blow dryers and vanity areas since the place does get busy. Also the doors to the toilets don't close properly. Location is good if you work in that area and if you take Cathay Pacific. You can check in by the airport express. Very convenient. The rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable. Minuses: Having to change elevators. Everyone needs to check in the 103rd floor then take another lift to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Go there for the view. Then back to Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: gipsodrivesabentley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK in terms of quality. Maybe too Dubai-China rich in style, but that's taste. The view on Hong Kong Island is amazing. I believe the standards of the hotel are designed around the needs of a "new" set of customers from Asia. So it might not necessarily always meet the taste of Old World travellers. Prices are outrageous, but maybe that's what new clients want: show off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But too Far and doesn't cost effective.”
Reviews.Author: Love M
Reviews.Content: We stay in a over $10,000 HKD suite 70Sq.M But seems very small. Compare to a suite in Excelsior or JW. It's more bigger in less price!!! The service is excellent but If you come to HK.You normally go in and out to shopping. It's bad thing is that to get to your room you need to walk so far and with 2 eleevatos up to your room so my advice just get the other hotel if you want to go shopping. But if you are staying in the hotel to swim in the highest swimming pool get this one. Just save money and get nice suit in other hotel in a shopping area if you going out.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate grand luxury.”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaCHT
Reviews.Content: Most luxurious stay in Hong Kong with high end shopping center underneath linked to MTR and airport express, Sky dining 101, and great location in Kowloon if your searching for an upscale living. Warm and top service at arrival with free upgrade. Turn down service at Ritz Carlton are the best especially during anniversaries of the hotel where you are given a lion soft toy and chocolates beside your bed. The rooms were spacious, clean and nicely designed from the ceiling to the floor. The room had Nespresso machines, apples and well boxed amenities. The bathroom was luxurious with separate shower, toilet and bath. The bath compromised nice soaps and bath salts and a TV to watch. The Ozone bar named the highest bar in the world lavish with reasonable pricing delicious food and cocktails. The ESPA spa was always fully booked disappointed I didn't get a chance to try it. Some improvements the hotel needed was the breakfast! Breakfast was probably one of the worst I've tried in a 5 star hotel. However restaurants near the hotel are amazing. Overall, the Ritz may have been a little pricey but 'you get what you pay for'.

Reviews.Title: “Two good things”
Reviews.Author: carlrob220
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the OZONE bar for the first advantage, the second would be the staff! Real friendly and courtesy!

Reviews.Title: “It's not puttin' on the Ritz in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Donbassero
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the new Ritz Carlton Hong Kong currently has bragging rights as the worlds tallest hotel. That is certainly a major marketing factor. But as hotel chains are constantly battling for that title, particularly in Asia, that will likely be a short lived distinction. Once that title is taken away, what then? The best thing I can say about this new hotel is that from its lofty perch atop the International Commerce Centre in Kowloon, the views are stellar--providing they aren't obscured by cloudy skies or smog. The service I received, while top notch, wasn't particularly outstanding as one would expect from this hotel chain--or any five star property for that matter. The hotel clearly is relying on its WOW! factor, with lots of splash and glam, but is sorely misses the mark of its predecessor, the former Ritz Carlton in Central, in that it lacks the sudued elegance and refined sophistication and personal luxury that I had come to rely upon. Also, for me personally, a major distractor was the inconvenient layout which required taking an elevator up to the lobby, then taking a different elevator in order to access your room. The same inconvenient choreography.was required to reach the hotel restaurants (substandard for five star hotel),bars and swimming pool or fitness facilities. Give it a miss for your choice of hotel in Hong Kong, as better choices abound, both in Kowloon and Central. If you still have the need to visit the world's tallest hotel first hand, check out the facilities for cocktails or tea, but check in elsewhere..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: TokyoNeil
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel; superb views when the HK smog permits from fantastically laid out rooms. Nice touches like an in-room ipod preloaded with music. Great bathroom, usual very high standard of service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A view is not enough....”
Reviews.Author: Elysia
Reviews.Content: Yes the view is stunning - and it's a unique experience to lie in bed and watch the tops of clouds roll by. But frankly this novelty wears pretty thin, pretty fast. Forget about an easy trip off the Airport Express to the Ritz-Carlton - it's a nightmare. So if this is the criteria for selecting a hotel in Hong Kong for a quick stopover don't pick the RC. The staff are under trained and would be more suited to working in a Maxims.  The interior design is OTT and completely kitsch - followed closely by the lobby artwork. A mish mash of styles and textures favoured by designers with no skill. The room has numerous design flaws the most annoying being the fact that the luggage rack is in the wardrobe. It's not deep enough to house an open bag so you can't close the doors and the light is activated by the doors - so bad luck you can't turn off the light. The wash basin had mould around it - no excuse for this. The guest room ceiling is full of exposed sprinkler heads (as distinct from concealed) - not very 5 star. Yet the bathroom is lined with travertine. The rooms are dark and glary. The lifts smelled, the guest room corridors smelled and unfortunately our room smelled dreadful. Stale musty and skanky. What is going on? We dined in the Chinese Restaurant. The food was different and just not good.  Duck breast in almond flakes? The buffet breakfast provided was extensive - but funnily enough there were only about five guests at 8 am.  We will never return.  For the price of around $600US you can do much better at The Pen or Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Lounge & Bar Great for Lunch with a View”
Reviews.Author: dljhk
Reviews.Content: Ate at the Lounge and Bar for lunch today and not only enjoyed the food and service, but the view is spectacular with very creative seating by the windows. The Ritz salad was extremely tasty and the broccoli with the vegetarian executive lunch was outstanding. The cheese cake dessert with blueberries was unique and delicious. However, what was most impressive was the service. The server noticed that we had enjoyed the baguette in the bread basket brought to the table first and came over to ask if we wanted more, then brought another entire basket of the baquettes, now that is how service should be done! Highly recommend it for a special lunch experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or vacation”
Reviews.Author: casa360
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the new Ritz Carlton Hotel in Hong Kong. The do a wonderful job of meeting you in the 9th floor (ground floor) lobby and whisking you up the the main hotel lobby on floor #103. a little bit longer wait for an elevator than a normal hotel, but really not much difference. Rooms start at 108 - 118. we were on floor #112. We had a spectacular view which was not their premier Harbour View hotel. but from 112 floors up, you see plenty of water and plenty of Hong Kong. The rooms were extremely modern and comfortable. The room we had was not a typical rectangular room. it was very dramatic. Buffet breakfast was fantastic, and the omelet maker was on his "A" game. Concierge was terrific. Ozone the lounge/Bar on the 118th floor is dramatic, especially the outdoor area when open. The pool is the coolest thing i have ever seen. and what a great way to end the day in the outdoor jacuzzi on 118. The only negative experience that we had was at the fine restaurant Tosca. The setting was glitzy, the food was superb, but at 9:00 it was filled with tourist or local families with their nannies and children. it ruined the setting.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view from the hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Maria Isabel B
Reviews.Content: great location and view. Tallest building in Hong kong. Excellent service of the staff. try the pool on floor 118 is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail. They remember your needs”
Reviews.Author: Greg799
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoy a hotel where they remember your particular needs. For me, it happens to be a gluten-free experience. After the first few hours, it became apparent that, somehow, and somewhat magically, the staff were informed of this requirement. Every restaurant, meal ( whether with the corporate event I was a part of, or personally), there was a recognition of the need and prompt follow through. Gluten free bread at every meal, often without asking. I quite like that. Of course the views are stunning. The food is great. But the attention to my personal needs will be the one thing hat brings me back.

Reviews.Title: “Bragging rights”
Reviews.Author: CHM1
Reviews.Content: You stay here because you can still claim that you've stayed at the "highest" hotel in the world. It's true, the view over Victoria Harbour and the city is absolutely phenomenal. You'd feel no different than if you are flying over the city in a helicopter. Stayed here when it opened in 2011 and had a corner suite so room size was good. Rooms are not as luxurious as I had expected, and the telescope they put at the window is more for show than being really useful (actually it feels downright cheap). Service as a whole was excellent. Because the building is so tall, you will be shrouded in the clouds if it's overcasted/rainy. Food outlets are all quite good, but I found the selection on their menus not extensive. But anyway, you have a big mall at your feet so there are at least another dozen of choices you could choose from. It's a great location with convenience being on top of the Airport Express station. Only the W and Four Seasons in Central could enjoy such direct link to the airport. But if you need to go to other parts of Hong Kong, Kowloon Station could be somewhat of a drag. The hotel gym was nicely equipped but not great (want more heavy-duty equipment), and the indoor pool at 118/F was a little disappointing, not because it's not good, but the outdoor pool at the W at 76/F was so great because of the views all around.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: taiwantraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a one-night "stay-cation" here on his birthday. The customer service was incredible. We ended up getting a free room upgrade and had an incredible view of Kowloon and the HK skyline whenever the clouds decided to part and grace us with the glory of the best views in the city. The room had a lot of nice little details that made the stay special. We had the Chocolate Afternoon Tea at Cafe 103 which was decadent. We took advantage of the in-room service for dinner which was like having the restaurant brought to our room. We finished off the evening at Ozone and the staff were fantastic. Check-out took a little longer than I would have liked but we could have taken advantage of the option of Express Check out which is done through e-mail. The Ritz certainly knows how to make you feel welcome and comfortable. There was alway someone on staff available to help. The Ritz also helped me to arrange reservations for Tea and a table at Ozone in advance. It further provided additional options such as ordering a cake and private transportation from the airport. Their attention to detail and anticipating the needs of guests was very professional. Highly recommend the stay.

Reviews.Title: “My New Home in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: d000000
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Hong Kong is probably the best hotel in the world. Full stop. I've been fortunate enough to travel the globe and stay in some top hotels. This hotel really is the best I've stayed in to date! You might ask why, so let me explain and offer a few tips to make your stay that little bit more enjoyable. Firstly, at the time of writing and the time I visited, this was the highest hotel in the world. It's also got the highest bar in the world. That makes it a special place. Spend some time up there when it's not cloudy (it does get cloudy quite a bit) and you get some of the most fantastic views of Hong Kong. The hotel is beautifully designed and finished. I'm no writer, but it's an elegant blend of tradition with all the modern comforts you could need. The smallest room is 50+ square metres. Big by any standard. The rooms are beautiful. Lots of room, comfy beds and fantastic bathrooms. I have stayed here multiple times and the staff are superb; very polite and friendly. Breakfast in the Lounge and Bar is a buffet. Fantastic food. Not the largest selection you'll find, but excellent food in opulent but comfortable surroundings, with those amazing views. I haven't had a chance yet to try any of the other restaurants in the hotel. I'm sure they'll be up to the same standard. Now for a few practical notes: The Airport Express train does indeed terminate in the bottom of the building (Kowloon station), but with luggage it's a fair trek through the shopping mall to the hotel reception. Get a cab from the airport. Better still, ask the hotel to pick you up from the airport (and if you want something special, ask for a Rolls Royce Phantom). The Ozone bar at the top of the hotel gets busy with non hotel guests. They can cause queues at the lifts, although I've not yet experienced any major disruption from them. Location - the hotel is not in the middle of the action, so taxis don't seem to frequent the reception as much as other hotels (just allow plenty of time if it's raining/busy), but stand outside at the taxi pick up point, look at the view of Hong Kong and you'll remember why you chose to stay there! The MTR in the base of the building connects you directly to Hong Kong island. I probably haven't convinced you that this is the best hotel in the world. Let me finish by saying that I travel to Hong Kong regularly and think that it's full of world class hotels. There were great. This is better. Quite simply The Ritz Carlton is my new home in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Sky High View”
Reviews.Author: VowRenewalTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new and still has some kinks to work out, but the view is phenomenal. The club lounge is worth the upgrade. We only went out to eat once, would have gone twice but there is a problem that needs to be solved. The taxis would not pick up a fare at the Ritz at dinner time. Unlike other hotels there was no taxi line. In NYC Central Park the doorman recognized us as club level guests and put us in the house car. This Ritz bell staff acted like there was no such animal. While Herve in the club lounge was excellent, some of the others seemed more proud of their English than in getting the product right. We were sent 20 minutes away to go shopping for a louis vuitton purse, when the mall connected to the hotel had a nicer louis store, and many others to boot. They have a real problem with their limo service, it needs to be fixed. The staff tried to upsell us, even though at a discount, but it came across very bait and switch, rather than as a nice gesture. Would I go back, yes. I will hope they have corrected the issues, but I could spend a lot more time exploring the hotel and Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Staggeringly beautiful but a little unwelcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Marius71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a week of business in Hong Kong. The idea of staying in the world's highest hotel was quite appealing. To make it extra special we thought we'd upgrade to a club rate to enjoy the facilities available on the club floor. On arrival at the street level lobby you're met with a seating area, a counter selling sweets of some kind and some staff members who do a combination of welcoming and herding you. It all feels a little stark and I, for one, felt a little uneasy. There isn't an intuitive flow to the whole experience. To make matters worse one must now travel up to the 103rd floor where, if you're a club guest, you have to pass what is clearly a check in reception area and find another set of lifts which takes you to the 116th floor. Here, on exiting the lift, you're met with a desk staffed by two people. No, it's still not the check in area. It's the spa. For check in you need to pass the lifts again and go around the corner and through a set of double doors into a little lobby with two desks. Soon enough someone emerges to check you in. While waiting for my room I thought I'd sit at the pool. It's on the 118th floor. With the use of someone else's key card I could operate the lift's buttons and up I went. One exits the lift to find another lobby (deserted) with a desk. Above the desk is a sign saying "Fitness centre" and "Swimming pool". Following the arrows leads you down a stark corridor which ends at a locked door. Through it you can see exercise bikes. Not a soul. I turned back to see if I'd reads the sign correctly. I had but thought I'd continue past the desk and search the other side of the corridor. At the end one encounters the men's lockers. Deserted. Back I went in the original direction as I was sure I saw another door along the way. Yep. Found the door. Opened it to see if that's where the pool was. No. This was the service entrance to the bar area which was closed until 5pm. More desolation. I just gave up at this point and went back downstairs to 116. On arrival back in the check in area I was met with strange looks from those who'd directed me to the pool. I wasn't going to explain. I asked if I could sit and wait there. I could. After about 30mins I was offered a coffee. I accepted. After that I just had to get out of there because I had the overwhelming feeling that I was imposing on these people. So I navigated my way through the maze of lifts and lobbies and left the hotel completely. I returned an hour later as I was now expecting to get a room. Nope. It took another hour and a half. I spent the time sitting in the check in area again, reading. After a while I asked if I could help myself to another coffee. Yes, I could. The I sat feeling as if I was in the way for an hour and a half. At no point did anyone explain to me that this was the club lounge and that I was free to enjoy the fare on offer. I'm not a presumptuous kind of person so I'd never just assume something like that. Finally the room was ready. What a treat. As a reward for my patience they very kindly upgraded us to a suite. It was quite unexpected and we were completely grateful for the gesture. However, the lost feeling continued every time one left the room. Nothing is sign posted or clearly marked and the hotel doesn't have a natural or intuitive flow to it. In fact, later that evening when we thought we'd check out the Ozone bar on 118 we ended up going through the service entrance again as that was the only door we could find. The looks we got from the cleaning lady, you can just imagine. So, in a nutshell, the place is spectacular but a little aloof and offish and it definitely left us feeling a bit "unwanted". Would I recommend it? I guess. It's an experience but by no means the best hotel in town. For that I'd suggest the Island Shangri La.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: washing2nian
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights over Easter - 2 adults, 2 adult children and one 11-year old. Had a harbour room suite with a connecting room on the 107th floor. View is to die for. Had club room access and only ventured out once to dine (in one of the hotel restaurants). Club lounge is open 24/7 with presentation after presentation, all of them excellent, with lots of choices as well as the wine and drink selections. But the best of all was the staff in the club lounge - WONDERFUL and HELPFUL. We were supposed to only stay for 3 nights and the other 2 nights was to have been spent at the Mandarin Hotel, but we cancelled the Mandarin to enjoy 2 more days/nights at the Ritz Carlton! The only "bad" part is that our children did not want to leave the hotel to venture out and explore the city as they were perfectly happy to just sit and relax in the lounge or go swimming or shop in the mall underneath the building. On our return to the airport, we took the Airport express train from the Kowloon station in the underground mall, where they have airline check in counters, luggage checkin (you don't see your checked in luggage until your final destination) and they give you boardingpasses, you hop on the train and then you dont have to deal with the hassle at the airport, just go straight to security, very smooth and convenient..(this of course has nothing to do with the hotel, but I have a feeling not too many guests knows about this). We are planning to be back one day, for sure. Oh, one morning we woke up and looked out from our window and the clouds were under us and the sun was shining, felt like being on an airplane, so cool.

Reviews.Title: “Not Baby Friendly AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Frederick A
Reviews.Content: No baby changing table and proper high chair in the lobby lounge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surreal roof top pool”
Reviews.Author: Globaltattler
Reviews.Content: I am generally not a fan of high towers and we stayed here only to redeem our Starwood Points! With business hotels, I have learnt even brand names don't guarantee great service or a great experience- sometimes over-crowding leads to delayed/ poor housekeeping, rude staff, lousy room service and so on. The Ritz Carlton Hong Kong (at Kowloon), however, was superb. The Management was strong and solved any issues promptly. We had been given 2 adjoining rooms as we travelled with our children and nanny, and the adjoining room was not a Twin Room as expected. We were told to wait 2 hours for the next available pair of King and Twin rooms to be available...which we were OK with, since we had not made our reservation requests clear from the start and could not fault the hotel for the oversight. After the 2 hours, the Management came up and personally over-saw our move to a complementary upgrade suite and adjoining twin room. It was a kind gesture we truly appreciated. Thereafter, we had no issues at all during our very pleasant stay. Room service was prompt, housekeeping was like clockwork and responded within 5 minutes for any requests, the children's room was specially set up with details like children's bath toys and soaps, robes/ slippers and so on. The pool was an incredible experience, with a wall panel of beach front images and ceiling of lighted "sky", and outdoor hot tub. We literally sat in a cloud and dipped in the warm water. The view was not great because of the cloudy weather, but this cleared up the following day and we enjoyed vast views of the city before us. The only negative experience I can recall would be of a local mother bringing her child with her to the steam room (which was really a 2-seater room), and the child obviously was unable to sit still in the heat for more than 30 seconds at a go- she kept getting up to open the door, go out, return etc and the room remained un-steamy to say the least...there seemed to be no governance over who or what age group was let into the facilities. The only other few points I would raise perhaps would be that the Ozone Bar was mainly patronized by middle aged tourists, and we had our more fun and hip drinking time at the W Hotel next door. The door greeters could not remember us as guests even thought we trooped in and out for 4 days (we would occasionally get "Good Afternoon welcome back!" and more often "welcome to the Ritz Carlton"...which was disconcerting...at other hotels such as the Four Seasons, greeters would always remember who was a room guest and not, and even call us by name). The bed was not comfortable for me as it did not have individual springs and heaved each time my husband moved. All in, we had a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to find itself”
Reviews.Author: worldlyCanada
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Kowloon is one of the Ritz’s newer properties. Following the trend of hotels like the St. Regis in Shenzhen, the Ritz towers 118 floors high, with its lobby being housed on the 103rd floor. Rooms are well-appointed and restaurants and bars are trendy if not a bit over-designed at times. While the hotel affords a nice relaxing stay, it’s not overly practical for the business traveler. The use of two separate elevator systems coupled with a location far from Central Hong Kong make the hotel a quirky option in which to do business, particularly given the variety of competition. What was most surprising was how poorly trained many of the lobby staff are. As one who remembers the old Ritz Carlton where service was impeccable, this Ritz seems to be more interested in populating the lobby with eye candy; pretty people who seem to panic when you ask them for advice and respond to you in a robotic manner. It became a running joke when one lobby attendant continually said “Welcome to the Ritz Carlton”, despite the fact that I had walked passed him six times that day. A nice property but it somehow lacks the sophisticated elegance of the old Hong Kong Ritz. Maybe with time it will find its soul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emjayw1953
Reviews.Content: Stayed only three nights. Stunning Harbour and Island views from our room on 117th. floor. Immaculate service from staff in Club Lounge. The open air terrace part of the bar on the 118th. has to be on everyone's bucket list. The spa and pool on the 118th. floor have to be seen to be believed.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: BradfordR
Reviews.Content: I am a Ritz-Carlton platinum hotel member (meaning I have stayed at least 75 nights at their hotels in the last year) and have stayed at many Ritz-Carltons. This one however absolutely tops the list and is nothing short of amazing!! Most people talk about the views (and they are stunning, and I have included 2 images from the 2 rooms we had), but for me, what made the hotel so incredible was the service. We used the hotel to pick us up from the airport, and was picked up in an S class Mercedes and taken to the hotel (the Ritz-Carlton representative at the airport was amazing upon both our arrival and departure). Upon getting out of our car at the hotel, we were met by one of their wonderful staff members, Elisa, who was so welcoming, and took us straight to our room (no going through a front desk). She helped to see that many of our special needs (which was no easy task) were met. My friend who is not a Ritz-Carlton member received the same service. That was the beginning of being treated like royalty throughout our stay. I highly recommend the club lounge. It is SO worth the extra money. The food there is incredible and the staff are unbelievably polished. Though there were many guest, the staff always referred to us by name. We felt like total VIP's, and the floor manager Hervé is heads and shoulders above any other I have seen in his position. He came and introduced himself, spent time getting to know us, helped us plan itineraries and was so friendly throughout our stay. When we changed rooms 1/2 way through our stay (just a few rooms down), he insisted on coming personally and helping us with our suitcases and making sure that all was okay. I could go on and on and name other staff members that made our stay so unbelievable. I have never seen a group of people try so hard to make sure we had a 10+ experience. Most places we vacation to is based on the location. There are a few places however where we will vacation to just to visit the hotel again. This is definitely one of those places and tops my list of the absolute best hotel in the world

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Silkysultry
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights from 22-26 March 2012. Room on Level 115 with view of HK Island and pier. Stunning view no doubt. Although the hotel is pretty new, but the closet and coffee table are a bit tired, which is a bit surprising. Location wise is great because the Airport Express station is beneath the hotel. Very convenient. Airlines check-in is also available so a big plus point. Only thing lacking is daily fresh fruits. For the rate they are charging, would expect them to serve fresh fruits everyday, but nope. Was a bit disappointed because my previous stayed in Conrad and Shangri-la had that little touch so expected Ritz to offer the same kind of little touches as well. The staffs were friendly and helpful. Response time was quick when I requested for extra bottled water. Would I stay in this hotel again? Unless there are no availability in Conrad and Shangri-la then I'll consider. Would I recommend to my friends to stay? Yes, at least for 1 time in their lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “just super”
Reviews.Author: Cardhu2009
Reviews.Content: for us the best Ritz Carlton. price value excellent!! great service, rooms spacius, when the sky is clear super view , we stayed on floor 112. ask for harbour view, is worth the diverence. staff super, service excellent, we have really enjoyed the time there, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new All Glass paradise”
Reviews.Author: scmnj
Reviews.Content: Sleep higher then the Empire State Building when staying at the RC HK, with the most amazing views all around Hong Kong in Kowloon. Rooms are extremely comfortable with all the amenities you can imagine and seats by the glass wall, from where you can see Hong Kong Island, the Harbor, Kowloon and the helicopters passing by down below. Hotel takes floors 103 to 118, where they have an indoor pool overlooking HK with lounge chairs by the window, an outside whirlpool and a bar. Plenty of restaurants at the hotel or in the upscale mall in the same building. Easy access to downtown Kowloon using train or taxi. Service is excellent. Fabulous choice in HK.

Reviews.Title: “High up above”
Reviews.Author: sasha w
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the rit carlton and i must sa its the best hotel ive ever stayed at. It is a little hard to find through the mall but through the car passage its great. even though the hotel is located at 109 stories up its great fun getting there. It is a little pricey but it is well worth what you pay for. The pool is great. the room i stayed on was on the 118th floor. and i was surprised it came with an Ipod classic! the bathroom was even more spectacular. But i would highley recommend this hotel if you would like to spend some money

Reviews.Title: “High in sky, worth trying, mixed value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kostiantyn
Reviews.Content: Arrival Kowloon station is one of the 4-5 stops on airport railway express, no need to bother on the car transfer. From the station it takes a 10 minutes walk to get to hotel entrance The four elevators could be crowded but are getting you on 100+ floor within seconds when you are in, hotel staff is managing the logistics process constantly. The other four elevators are used for 100+ floors from the hotel lobby level. Hotel Exquisite design of the hotel, the rooms are top-notch. quiet and for techno geeks with multiple devices, Ipod for use over stay. ask for Victoria bay view room at check in Spa and pool are great. The views from the room and club lounge are impressive, especially at night, but are naturally weather dependent (so bring sun and clear sky with you :). No need to pay extortinate same-day ticket prices and waste a truckload of time for a Burj Al Arab comparable view :) Location Area is clearly developing with major construction going on within 1 km of the hotel, but with ltrend-setting hotels (Ritz, W Hotel), great mall and offices already in place, it will be growing into a great place to be. 20 minutes walk to the bay/ferry, but taxis are very cheap though not that luxurious (old toyotas vs mercedes benz somewhere in Germany). Taxis from the centre could be challenging to fins late at night, so use public or hotel taxi stands. Service The staff is courteous in best Asian traditions. The concierge experience is mixed = employee-dependent. Overall, a landmark hotel worth trying once, if you could lift the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Tallest hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: monique l
Reviews.Content: This is the tallest hotel in world with 118 floors and where the bar Ozone is located. We stayed there twice since the grand opening. Their Executive Club Lounge is on the 116th floor with spectacular view only when the weather is clear. The staff is so well trained and friendly and the place is very comfortable that you don't want to leave. One more thing to mention is their chocolate cookies are outstanding that they disappear very quickly. There are 5 sessions of food served daily and all are very good except for the afternoon items which are average. Their Chinese restaurant Tin-Lung-Heen is not bad and awarded with 1 Michelin star. Buffet breakfast at the Lounge has many varieties and good baking items. The hotel is connected to the Elements Mall but I still prefer the IFC Mall better. I did try their pastries from the shop at the Lobby. They are very nice to look at and very pricey but have a very ordinary taste. Taxis are needed for transportation although there are buses and subway which may be a little confusing for a visitor in Hong Kong. The decoration of the hotel is a little too much for us but staff is very courteous and friendly. They are always there and try to help as much as they can. After all , this is a nice hotel and just hope you have lots of luck to enjoy the view from your room on a clear day. My husband and I just stayed there 2 weeks ago and we had a very nice and clean room although the housekeeping service was quite slow for the first two days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities at the highest hotel in Hong Kong but limited entertainment options due to its location.”
Reviews.Author: GranDia
Reviews.Content: Impressive is what strikes you when you first check in. The rooms are located as high as one can go in Hong Kong. When the weather's foggy, however, you may be up in the clouds but you won't see anything from your window! The staff in the lobby can be overbearing as they will greet you a dozen times to the point that it gets to look like its perfunctory rather than sincere. I'm sure they truly want to make one feel welcome but it gets into you if overdone. The music in the lounge is good. A mix of jazz and pop makes it relaxing enough to just "chill" out. The Ozone Bar on the 118th floor is for a younger crowd but it's well appointed. The problem is the hotel's location is a bit far from the real Hong Kong nightlife of either Kowloon or Hong Kong leaving one with very few options. The mall (Elements) has a plethora of luxury stores but if you are looking for electronic goods, this is not the place. If you are not fussy about either shopping or nightlife but can settle for a nicely appointed 5 star hotel facilities, then the Ritz Carlton is a great place to be. It's convenient as the Kowloon station is directly accessible. If you want shopping and the nightlife then go find a hotel in the more traditional locations.

Reviews.Title: “Too high”
Reviews.Author: Mpollifax
Reviews.Content: This is the tallest building in Hong Kong and the fourth tallest in the world. The hotel is located on the 103rd floor and above. You would think you'd have a great view but more than half the time we were enshrouded in clouds. The room was very well appointed and roomy with two closets and separate tub and shower as well as double sink in the bathroom. Very adequate drawer space was provided. The amenities provided by the hotel were quite nice. Service was very good. That being said, it took about 15 minutes just to get out of the hotel and into the attached mall, and that's using the two elevators and three escalators provided. Once in the mall, the metro was right there. Walking around the hotel was more problematic. There was a lot of construction and you had to find your way to the overhead walkway to navigate safely. There was not a walkway around the bay by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a jewel box in the sky! amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: lkrocks
Reviews.Content: this amazng hotel is almost in the clouds! it begins over the 110'th floor and is so oppulent an luxurious that you will always remember your stay! the views fromt he ceiling to floor windows are spectacular. everything is done in spectacular style and the staff is amazing! was lucky enough (guest of others so did not pay) to have a room that had access to the concierge floor, which just makes the experience even better...you can eat and drink all day there. room service, the spa, the gym, etc were also excellent. hard to find anything wrong with this hotel..enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning view, perfect service, quality details.”
Reviews.Author: IKZ2411
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel. The rooms are furnished so beautifully, the service is outstanding, the pool and the view were divine. Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “What a 5 star hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: Raybull
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to believe or rather understand how some had anything but a wonderful experience at this ritz. My wife and I were concluding a brief tour of Asia and we stayed at Conrad and St Regis properties but this one was tops. We could not get enough of the fantastic views from every part of the hotel. The pool was spectacular and a must on your visit even if just to take a look. What completely put this property over the top was Joe Ku who works the airport for Ritz Carlton airport. He was there waiting for us and looking for us on our return. If I have one observation was the quality not the service of the breakfast buffet could be a touch better. After staying at several 5 star resorts or hotels in a row I might be a bit spoiled but it is a ritz carlton after all.

Reviews.Title: “2012 chinese new year - very average”
Reviews.Author: Russell T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night over chinese new year, having previously spent four nights at the Four Seasons on Hong Kong Island and two nights in the Four Seasons on Macau. Both the macau and ritz carlton properties were disappointing, but for different reasons. The ritz-carlton property has phenomenal views (of course), and the infrastructure (rooms etc) is good, but not outstanding. The biggest drawback was the quality of service - we arrived at 3pm and waited for over ten minutes to get service at reception. We were then informed that our room, promised on the website to be available at 2pm, would not be available until 4pm. And that we could enjoy a complimentary soft drink! After expressing considerable dissatisfaction, the surly receptionist finally agreed to give us one alcoholic drink as we wait for another hour. For a brand-new hotel in one of the most hospitality-competitive cites in the world - the ritz carlton has seriously under performed. As far as super-tall hotels go, the park and grand hyatts in Shanghai are much better. Definitely not in the league of the Four Seasons Hong Kong or the Landmark Oriental. Profoundly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Lack atmosphere due to its location and set-up”
Reviews.Author: hippodiver
Reviews.Content: This hotel's view and convenience to get to the airport via the Airport Express are its main selling points. Unfortunately, due to its location to the main actions in HK and its set-up (details below) the hotel seriously lacks atmosphere. The Check-In Process: Depending on whether you are coming by car or by train (Kowloon Station), you first need to get to the hotel's entrance lobby on Level 9. The check-in desk is on Level 103 however. Depending on what time of year and day you happen to check in, it may take a while. I had to wait about 20 mins when I checked in at around 12:30pm as there were only 2 check-in staff behind the counter and a long queue of tourists wanting to exchange money, checking out, asking directions, etc. Once checked in, you need to take another elevator to get to your room. The Room: I was fortunate to be upgraded to the Grand Deluxe room facing out to the harbour on Level 113. The room was very nice and the view was very impressive as expected. The room was as described in the hotel's web site but it took me a bit of time to find out where everything was. The separate shower with the rain shower head was very nice. One thing that was missing surprisingly was the shoe tree given that there were several amenities for the shoes. When I travel on business, the only few amenities that I need are fast wireless internet access, free local phone and shoe tree. I did not need the extra TV in the bath tub, the iPod, the iPod/iPhone dock/spreaker or the double bathroom sinks. The hotel seems to have spent money on making the room luxury for tourists and less functional for business travellers. Being HK, it was cloudy on most of the days so I could hardly see anything outside from the room. The Pool: The pool was on Level 118 but it was disappointing. The view was not visible at night and the pool's set-up was a bit cramped by the fancy long chairs. It is an indoor pool so I wonder why anyone would need long chairs. The Breakfast: This was the most disappointing part of the hotel. Given its class, the breakfast was very average and nothing to write home about. You eat there for the view and not for the quality of food. The Location: The hotel is situated in the tallest office building linked to a mall. You spend a lot of time going up and down elevators and escalators. The restaurants in the building are limited and expensive and the shops are really for the wealthy tourists. In terms of quality of decor, amenities/facilities and staff helpfulness, this hotel ranked high (but not the best compared to other hotels). If my company was not located in this building and I was not on a business trip then I don't think I would stay here. When I stayed here, it felt a bit like a tourist attraction with herds of Chinese or Russian tourists with their expensive shopping. The hotel's lobby was not very inviting for you to have a stop and enjoy a short break. This is a shame as it could have been so much better!

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for the view”
Reviews.Author: jansumMacau
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a Harbour View Club room on a weekend trip to Hong Kong. First impressions were not good. We walked in the hotel entrance and there was no obvious signage of where to check-in. We walked over to a desk that had three staff members behind it. One was on the phone and 2 others talking to each other. The 2 talking to each other glanced at us but kept talking to each other. Eventually we had to interrupt them to ask where check-in was. We were than directed to the 103 floor. When we got to the 103 floor we were redirected to the 116 floor club lounge for check in. Surely they could have asked us at the hotel entrance whether or not we had a club reservation. After eventually getting to the Club lounge for check-in it took another 30 minutes to get the room keys. This was pretty long when we arrived at the hotel at 2.30pm. Service after that improved greatly; with the Club staff especially pleasant The view from the room was fantastic but it was a shame the windows are very dirty. The room itself was nice but no better than most other 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. You are definitely only paying for the view at the Ritz which is outstanding from the room, the Club Lounge and bar. Unfortunately we could not get a reservation for the Italian Restaurant at the hotel for lunch or dinner; it books out well in advance ; so if you do decide to stay book the restaurant early. We stay in Hong Kong frequently and have experienced most of the 5 star hotels. The views are really the only key point of difference for the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: EDinoM
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Chinese New Year 2012. We took one of the hotel car transfers from the airport where we were met by two waiting staff - one at each exit to the arrivals hall who took us down to the driver for a very pleasant trip to the hotel. At the hotel we were greeted and shook hands with about 20 staff as we exited the car and entered the hotel lobby - which my wife and I thought was slightly odd. Rather than check in at the reservations desk we were escorted to our room and shown around before being checked into the hotel in the comfort of our room. We stayed in a corner Club room which was very nice. The Club was great and relaxing for breakfast or a drink anytime during the day or night. The room itself was well appointed with a great bathroom with a huge shower head and bath. laundry and room service was impeccable. Great pool and restaurants. The only two issues were that we tried to watch a movie on one of the 3 TV's in the room but found the system was down. When i called reception they said it was currently under repair and would be fixed soon. We never did get to see a movie. I guess one of the teething problems for such new hotel. The other issue is that you cannot walk from the hotel to where the action is. Even to get to Nathan road you need to take a taxi - which even though they are cheap- we found slightly annoying. We stayed at the Shaeraton about 10 years ago which was on the corner of Nathan Road and Salisbury Rd and it was great to be able to walk out of the hotel lobby and into the thick of it. One good thing is that you can walk into the large shopping centre below the hotel and get a direct train one stop to Hong Kong island. Overall we had a really great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class”
Reviews.Author: johncull56
Reviews.Content: Just go there, love it..... It had to be the best place in hong kong to stay...... Can,t say anymore about this Hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Club Level was decadent, even for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Mitch F
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days over Chinese New Year 2012. First of all, I had NO IDEA Hong Kong could ever be that cold. Good grief. Totally unprepared for that...and for this amazing hotel. We have stayed at several Ritz Carlton hotels and by far, without even a chance for debate, this one was the best to date for us. Settled in 115 floors up and yeah, that's quite a view looking down at Victoria Harbour to say the least. The club level food was the most expansive and varied of any Ritz we have enjoyed as well. How about a bottomless wine bar open 24/7! Need to grab some sparkling water, beer, gourmet sandwiches, you name it at 3 am? No problem. And the food choices varied greatly from day to day as well, not just a few of the items, but at least 50% of them. The decor from the big stuff down to the smallest details is gorgeous. I have no mind for that sort of thing, and admittedly I'm easily impressed by those with artistic minds, but I'm also not the type to ogle over wall paneling by elevators. But I did here. The service was spectacular all the way around. If you are uncomfortable with elevators or heights, this is definitely not the place for you. That said, we couldn't get enough of the views. Besides the cold, the visibility was at times limited, but still very impressive. Can't imagine how nice it is on perfectly clear days and nights. Didn't get the chance to use the pool or spa, but they were equally impressive looking. Yeah, it's a fortune. Use your miles if you can. But it's worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Noletrvlr
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel that made my trip memorable. The ladies and gentlemen at the hotel always went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. My wife did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Insanely Great!”
Reviews.Author: amlash
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its billing as the highest hotel in the world in more ways than one. It is sumptuous and extemely well-run. The hotel is brand new, the rooms are commodious, and the club-level is the best the Ritz has to offer. The location is a tad out-of-the-way for the major sights in Hong Kong, but it really does not pose much of a problem as cabs are inexpensive and readily available. The hotel is connected to a very, very upscale Mall with lots of dining options, plus a subway stop. And, best of all, from this Mall you can check in to your flight from the lower level and take a high-speed train directly to the airport which is the most convenient travel perk I have ever experienced. By all means splurge to have one of the greatest experiences of your life!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth splashing out on”
Reviews.Author: echristie
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay -what a place to recover from a long haul flight. Silly to leave the premises. There is no perfect location in Hong Kong. Hotel is located with excellent access to Kowloon station and fast train link to airport. Since this was not our first trip to HK, we used the train instead of hotel transfer. Multiple floors of very, very upmarket mall (by that I mean Gucci, Cartier & Co) underneath the ICC building, with hotel on top 15 or so floors. If you are into tall buildings and views, this is the place for you. Ozone Bar amazing. Splash out of delicious snacks here - Trio of mini burgers delightful. Drinks are of course five star prices, but so what? The view is what it's about. Pool is on 118th like Ozone bar. Wonderfully warm, very large pool with stunning views and electronic ceiling of clouds. Very sophisticated lighting scheme. Incredible swimming at night. If your budget does not stretch to a room, go to the bars or restaurants. But the little boxes containing the nightly turndown chocolates are gems in themselves. We had a room-only rate. As our room had a coffee machine we did what we have done many times before in Hong Kong and went shopping for our own breakfast and brought it back to the room for “food with a view”. The supermarket in the mall below the hotel is outstanding. Pickup some freshly prepared fruit and pastries and make your own coffee. I have added this because although I do not suggest you breakfast on European style pastries in the Far East - pastries from this supermarket were just about the best we have ever tasted. I recommend CITS for rates and mainland China visa if you need one. Even though stay was relatively pricey, I have to rate it highly for value for money as it was unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “$$$ but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alimcl
Reviews.Content: STayed here at the end of a three week trip to Europe and was in need of some 5 start treatment and got it in spades. We booked a club room so that included free brekkie, snacks and drinks all day. Cost was 5300 plus tax and was worth it. Rooms though Are not well sound proofed and you can hear what your neighbours are doing which is less than ideal if one of them has a screaming baby. Lot of construction work going on around so not pleasant to walk. Taxi to Tst is Approx 25HKD. Elements mall down stairs is nice and man my high end. If you arriving from the airport take the train to Kowloon. Quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every expensive penny...”
Reviews.Author: JRJRQP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz HK at the end of October on our first trip to Asia. Loved it and would recommend it 100%. We were in a junior suite on the 113th floor with the most amazing view of the HK side. Our room had a desk with attached bar and shelving, an adjoining seating area with sofa, a chair and a chaise lounge, plus there was bench seating along the entire perimeter (against windows). The bedding was great – very comfortable down and high thread counts. The bathroom was entirely set in stone with an enormous Jacuzzi tub and a shower with 2 shower heads (one above, one on pole). Good thing they have lots of hot water there because I didn’t want to get out of the shower! We are Marriott Platinum Elite members and were recognized as such by the Ritz (a partner hotel). There was a dessert and drinks awaiting our arrival as well as a welcome card and message on the TV for us. Truly, I felt like a rock star when we arrived. We elected to take the trip from the airport in the hotel’s Rolls Royce. When we came off the flight, 3 Ritz employees were waiting for us; ushering us through the airport and taking care of all our baggage, coats, etc. The drive was about 25 minutes and quite smooth. Loved the RR – it has some seriously comfortable seating, and that’s saying a lot coming off a 15 hour flight! When we got to the hotel, there were about 8 people outside waiting for us, including the front desk manager, concierge lounge manager, and several others. It was a whirlwind as they rushed us to the 1st set of elevators to go up to the lobby level. A single representative then escorted us to our room and showed us all the buttons and how-to’s, as well as explaining all the hotel services, etc. while finishing our check-in. The buttons are really cool in these rooms – can push a single button to request service, to make “do not disturb”, to turn off or on all lights, to open or close the drapes. I was thinking I could get used to that kind of thing. The concierge lounge is fantastic, and open 24 hours. It is very large and there is an extensive selection of food and drink. The foods are presented on a long island with Eastern foods on the left, and Western foods on the right. They make great omelets to order in the morning, and their pastries are perfect. I bake a lot, so I’m a tough person to impress when it comes to pastries. I think I ate 5-6 different selections each morning, along with my omelet and a ton of fresh squeezed orange juice. They also have excellent tea service there. Hevre, the manager, and the attendants there in the lounge were a special part of our visit. They were incredibly attentive to us – refilling OJ, making pots of tea, etc. plus asking about our visit with a genuine interest that couldn’t be faked. They helped us make many choices of sights to see, places to eat, and things to avoid. They made printouts and maps to help our days run more smoothly. I am truly grateful for their input and kindness. It felt like we had some friends in a foreign land and that was very comforting. FYI the lounge has breakfast in the morning, then appetizers in the evening and desserts at night. I think they take the bulk of it away around 11pm and then it’s just drinks and cookies (in the cookie jars by the couches). I ate a lot of cookies too. MMMmmm. One other thing to mention… at this hotel, people run to help you. And I do mean it when I say run. It was like our maid was doing cartwheels down the hall to press our elevator button for us, or if we needed more tea in our tea pot the attendant ran to the kitchen. I’d never seen anything like it – it was quite an experience. The odd thing is the people all seemed happy to do it. A few last notes: Room service was great – food quality and presentation excellent. We didn’t eat at any of the restaurants because of the dress code. We’re pretty casual people and it’s just not our thing to get dressed up for dinner. The fitness area was spectacular and like nothing else we’ve seen or even heard of. The pool had huge round lounges and the ceiling projected the sky for the time of day (blue sky and clouds during daytime). Bottom line: If you’re on the fence about staying at the Ritz, go for it. You DO get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Splurge and Enjoy the Views”
Reviews.Author: Travelette4666
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year's in a Harborview Suite. THe hotel is only 8 months old and it's doing very well. Nice and sparkling new. Great views of the Harbor. The breakfast buffet is great. The main restaurant of the hotel is very good. My husband loved the hamburger (of all things). There is a top shelf mall nearby. We took our 7 year old ice skating and to the movies several times during our stay. We stayed another time at the Upper House and I think they both are great but I liked the views here better. Service is very responsive though I do find myself wishing they understoon English better - maybe it's my US accent!
